info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 6:24AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, including the following areas, Litchfield County. Portions of east central New York, including the following areas, Dutchess and Ulster Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms may produce heavy rainfall leading to isolated to scattered flash flooding this morning into this afternoon. Total rainfall amounts will range from 1 to 3 inches. Hourly rainfall rates may briefly reach an inch per hour. Some flooding in urban and poor drainage areas is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
